text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response explicitly analyzes the concept of 'novus actus interveniens' (intervening act) in the context of legal causation. It discusses how the drunk driver's swerving acts as a potential intervening act and applies relevant tests (foreseeability, free/deliberate acts, proportionality) using case law (R v Roberts, R v Kennedy (No 2), R v Williams & Davis) to determine if the chain of causation was broken.", "criterion_id": "7cefb377-362e-4f53-8cee-a745ef9035ff"}
